page.title: 01Ecology _ Geography
page.content: Geographically the area is part of the flood plain of the River Parrett. The land is flat, made of alluvium, and is approx. 6 metres above sea level. The river is tidal and large deposits of silt are visible at low tide. The tidal 'BORE', a smaller version of the Severn Bore can be seen on this river section. At 320408 the Kings Sedgemoor Drain enters the Parrett. The Drain is part of the extensive, modern drainage scheme which controls the flooding of Sedgemoor. Small drainage ditches or rhines criss_cross the area and form field boundaries. High embankments flank the River Parrett. Old gravel pits at 2939 are flooded and are now used for recreational purposes. Land use is mainly agricultural, under permanent pasture. The South_east
